scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: This is a letter, August 1, 1932, from Margaret D[ouglas] Randolph, "Cloverfields," Keswick, Virginia, to Registered Service International, Winchester, Virginia, concerning advertisement for "Clover Fields" resort, Keswick, Virginia. Randolph comments that a Mr. H. I. Clarke from the service asked her to complete an application and pay a fee of twenty dollars in exchange for the promise of a great many tourists, which has not come to pass. Also included are a brochure "Clover Fields An Old Time Southern Home" and a black-and-white postcard with a picture of "Clover Fields."
